solution_line_template: We know that {people_came_in} people came in and {people_left} people left after Bethany's shift started, so there was a net change of {people_came_in} - {people_left} = <<{people_came_in}-{people_left}={net_change}>>{net_change} people.

If there are {people_now} people now in the gym and that is {net_change} more than when Bethany's shift started, we know there were {people_now} - {net_change} = <<{people_now}-{net_change}={initial_people}>>{initial_people} people lifting weights at the start of her shift.
